item.title: About
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Kim is a certified Master Core Strength Vinyasa Yoga Trainer who still maintains a fantastically fun flow style that anyone can come and rock right where they are. Her reverent irreverence makes learning from her a real-world delight. Kim attracts yoga lovers, anatomy geeks, fitness freaks, and those who don't mind a few f-bombs peppered throughout her profound and intuitive teachings.  Her message is always one of self love, self expression and empowerment which is exactly what she found for herself when she began her studies in this style of yoga and anatomy based on discovering one's true core power and using the tools of biomechanics, creative sequencing, practical inspiration and fabulous flow classes to access each student's freedom from the inside out.

Kim's classes welcome a wide range of students from teenagers, working moms, tattooed belly dancers and bemused but hooked husbands to women in their late 60's all in the same room, all working on that elusive handstand or arm balance together, and all feeling met and capable exactly where they find themselves on the mat that day.  She works on demystifying yoga postures and philosophy so that it can be simply accessed and understood--and directly applied to ease the suffering of even life's most pressing challenges.

Kim has taught yoga and pilates for nearly 12 years and is certified at the 500hr level in Core Strength Vinyasa with Sadie Nardini.  She continues to study yoga anatomy with Leslie Kaminoff and  has begun to mentor new yoga teachers helping them find their voice, hone their skills, and gain confidence in their teaching.   She recently had the honor of assisting Sadie Nardini and Tyler Mccoy at the New York Yoga Journal Conference as well as co-presenting for their workshop, Yoga of Success:  Message, Marketing, and Money.

What is Core Strength Vinyasa?

Core Strength Vinyasa is a perspective on all yoga created by founder Sadie Nardini. CSV simplifies how to access, comprehend and use the "deep core" or as we call it in CSV, "The Core Strength Muscle Meridian", more efficiently and gain the maximum benefits of yoga (Self-awareness, confidence, strength, flexibility, calorie burn...). Postures are always built by setting the foundation first, connecting to the deep core, and expressing in a much lighter way that reduces outer body tension. We incorporate specific core poses, transitions and sequencing that will bring the student into more core generated alignment improving safety and stability while causing a more efficient mind/body transformation.

item.title: Class Schedule and Upcoming Events
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Heated Pilates Flow Tuesdays @ 5:30pm

Heated Pilates Flow is a full body workout and the very best of the IMX Mat Program. HPF is choreographed to an inspiring and soulful playlist and performed in a warm 85° to promote the added benefits of detox, deeper stretching, and higher calorie burn.

IM=X Pilates Phoenix
3136 E. Indian School Rd.
Phoenix, AZ 85016
www.imxPilatesPhoenix.com

item.title: Offerings
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Core Strength Vinyasa Basics Workshop 3 hours

This workshop is perfect for yoga teachers and yoga practitioners of any style! Learn how to build each asana and flow through transitions in a more core generated way that improves safety and stability and helps to reduce outer body tension.

The Seven Core Cues- Going Deeper Into CSV 3 hours

This workshop dives deeper into the practice of CSV and gets more specific with the cueing we use to build each asana.

CSVY Master Class 2 hours

A perfect pairing to the Basics or Seven Core Cues. Learn the basics and then pull it together in a flowing practice.

Core Strength Vinyasa Immersion Training for Yoga Teachers

A training for yoga teachers who would like to learn how to teach Core Strength Vinyasa or just gain a fresh perspective for their current style. Learn cutting-edge anatomy, new cueing techniques, and help empower your students in their practice!

Yoga Teacher Coaching/Mentoring 1 hour minimum

Are you a teacher who fights with nerves, anxiety and/or self doubt? Kim is passionate about helping you break through these barriers, gain confidence, hone your skills, and find your own unique voice as a teacher.

item.title: Bhakti, Shakti & Yoga Anatomy
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
with Monica Page-Subia and Kim Bulloch

Thursday April 9th — Sunday April 12th, 2015 in Sedona

Join Master instructors Monica Page-Subia E-RYT and Kim Bulloch E-RYT for an inspirational, educational, FUN filled weekend at the incredible Mago Retreat Center in Sedona AZ. Kim and Monica are offering 3, yes, THREE amazing yoga immersions during this transformational weekend.

Register Now!

Yoga Anatomy Immersion

Muskuloskeletal system, fascia/myofascial connections, Core Strength Muscle Meridian, biomechanics of asana, the nervous system, and more!

Here is a tentative outline of what we plan to cover in the Yoga Anatomy Immersion (note: our intention is to cover each of these subjects, this may shift depending on how much time we take for each individual topic. Some topics may require more discussion than we have planned).

  1. Bones
    • Identify bones
    • "Bony landmarks"
    • What is bony compression & effects on asana?
    • Getting around the acromium process
    • Sacrum, movements of the pelvis
    • Joint movements relative to asana
    • Assisting using bony landmarks
  2. Muscles
    • Anatomy and Physiology of muscles
    • Mechanics of stretching
    • The muscles in asana and assists
    • Ligaments and tendons
    • The psoas muscle and connection to trauma
  3. Myofascial Lines (Anatomy Trains)
    • What is fascia and why is it so important?
    • Deep Front Line (Core Strength Muscle Meridian)
    • Superficial Back Line
    • Spiral Line
    • Importance in asana
  4. The Spine
    • Brief anatomy of the spine
    • Movements of the spine
    • Safety during asana
  5. The Nervous System
    • Sympathetic vs. Parasympathetic
    • Yoga for each
  6. Chakras & Anatomy

Show more

Core Strength Vinyasa Immersion - The 7 Core Cues

Core Strength Vinyasa Yoga founder and creator, Sadie Nardini, considers CSV a "perspective" on all yoga, rather than just its own style. The principles of CSV can be added to any style of yoga to help bring students into more "core" generated alignment, truly honoring the concept of sthira/sukha within each asana. The 7 Core Cues of CSV are sequential steps, always taught in order, that empower students through their transitions and into each asana with optimized alignment, strength, and use of the body in a much more holistic way.

The 7 Core Cues are based on the understanding of myofascial meridians (the fact that your muscles run in holistic, whole-body lines, not singular muscles as many people think), and unique bone and joint alignment where EVERY student is different. We believe that 90% of any yoga pose should be aligned BEFORE you get into the pose, not after you're already there. The 7 Core Cues expand on the concept of building each asana from foundation, to core, to expression and give more focus to a crucial new world of internal vs. external yoga cueing and aligning your students properly through the transitions.

Yoga teachers: Learning this information will light up your students in ways they have never experienced, and keep them coming back to your classes. It will also help you have a road map to safer instructing, every time. CSV will compliment your existing style, no matter what it is, so you don't have to give it up—we will just help you shore it up, to make your style much more effective, dynamic and safe!

If you're a yoga student wanting to learn how to ensure your yoga practice is giving you all the benefits, with way less chance of injury, this training is also for YOU!

In this immersion you will learn:

  • 2 Core Qualities of CSV: Contraction vs. Expansion Energy
  • 3 Core Elements to building every pose: Foundation, Core, Expression
  • 7 Core Cues: A further breakdown of 3 Core Elements

Show more

Bhakti Yoga Immersion - The Yoga of Devotion

Bhakti Yoga is the yoga of devotion. Bhakti is not mere emotionalism, it's challenge lies in the consistent practice of unconditional love- for others, all living beings, our community and ourselves. Bhakti Yoga actually engages rigorous tapas of the Mind and Spirit as we make the shift from fear to love, from head to heart. The Bhakti Yoga practices that facilitate this shift include chanting, puja, pranayama, meditation and asana practices, all transformed into offerings to, and communion with, the Divine and each other. The Bhakta seeks to dissolve the ego in order to be a transparency for God , and a servant to her/his fellows.

In this Immersion we will chant mantra:

A mantra can be thought of as a sonic embodiment of the supreme being who, through grace, takes infinite recognizable forms. - Jai Uttal
  • The meanings of each mantra. We'll find out about the deities, who each represent and amplify various positive qualities, such as love, courage, compassion, strength, abundance, etc.
  • Ideas on developing a personal practice, identifying our Ishta devata, and situational applications.
  • We will learn the difference between kirtan style chant and Vedic chant.
  • We will work with the bija mantras for each chakra.
  • The power of the Sanskrit language
  • If you play an instrument, or even have some percussion items, bring them!

We'll practice Bhakti Vinyasa and look at how we may apply Bhakti Yoga in our asana practice.

In the words of Sri BKS Iyengar

The body is my temple, asanas are my prayers.

We'll also observe Hanuman Puja, a ceremony that brings the qualities of Sri Hanuman, the ultimate Bhakti Yogi, into our beings and environment. These qualities include love, service, devotion, courage, an impeccable sense of timing, a delightful sense of humor, an ability to respond correctly and immediately to any situation, power to sustain our Dharma, our life's purpose, to name a few...

Show more

Are you ready to reserve your space for this transformational weekend?

Register Now!

item.title: Live Music, Bhakti & Core Strength Vinyasapalooza!
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Saturday November 15, 5–7:30pm at Spirit of Yoga

￼Please mark your calendar for a super AWESOME fund-raising event! Kim & Monica will be pairing up for a live music Bhakti Core Strength Vinyasa-Palooza! 100% of proceeds go into our scholarship fund for the Bhakti, Shakti, and Yoga Anatomy retreat in April 2015. You will be helping out a couple of kick asana, budding, new yoga teachers to gain some very valuable knowledge. Your participation in this event could help change a few lives which will in turn, change many through the Miracle that is Yoga!

$15 in advance or $20 at the door

Pre-Register Here

item.title: Core Strength Vinyasa Basics Workshop
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Join Kim Bulloch, 500 ERYT and CSV Master Teacher/Trainer, for a fun & information filled workshop to help you transform the way you teach and/or practice yoga. It doesn't matter what "style" of yoga you teach, the information you will learn in this workshop is meant to enhance any style of yoga! This workshop is open to yoga teachers and students alike! Teachers, get 3 contact hours of continuing education credit for your Yoga Alliance registration. When: Saturday, December 6th, 2014 from 1pm-4pm Where: Dark Star Yoga Studio at 10636 N. 71st Way #14, Scottsdale 85254 Price: $43 if you pay with credit/debit card OR $40 cash or check (must be paid in advance! Contact Kim for details on how to pay with cash or check) Workshop will include:
  • A brief overview of what it actually means to use your "core", it is more than crunches or saying "navel to spine".
  • Learn the Belly Bonfire Breath that helps to activate the deep core.
  • A brief overview of CSV transitions between asanas.
  • Part discussion and part asana practice.
Bring something to take notes and your mat. Contact Kim for more info at KimBulloch@gmail.com

Pre-Register Here

item.title: Homepage
item.dc:creator: kim
item.content:encoded:
Coming Soon!

New studio classes and Core Strength Vinyasa trainings are coming to the Phoenix area! Email Kim if you are interested in signing up for future CSV trainings. Class size will be very limited for for the CSV training sessions to ensure maximum attention for each participant. -add my email address to this page
